segments.text: I see the woman standing in the puddle, drying dishes like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, and she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, and I can’t believe how reckless he’s being.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the cookie jar is almost empty, and the kids are going to get in so much trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading across the floor, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is completely oblivious to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and the boy is going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman is when there’s so much chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR
